thread.title: NZ Post delivers free Active Family Fun Day this Sunday
thread.title_full: NZ Post delivers free Active Family Fun Day this Sunday

author: Fuseworks Media
title: NZ Post delivers free Active Family Fun Day this Sunday
text:
Fuseworks Media Thursday, 15 October, 2015 - 14:35 
New Zealand Post is giving families the chance to get active with shot-put legend Valerie Adams at a free Family Fun Day in Manukau, Auckland this weekend. 
The NZ Post Active Family Fun Day will be open from 1200pm to 4pm on Sunday 18 October at AUT’s South Campus, 640 Great South Road, Manukau. 
"We want people to bring their families along and join in the fun," says New Zealand Post sponsorship spokesperson, Jo Avenell. "Everyone will be able to have a go at a range of sports including cricket, hockey, waka ama, tennis, touch rugby and athletics." 
"There’ll be no charge for entry," says Jo Avenell. "A bouncy castle, inflatable slide and food stalls will be on site making this a great day out for the family." 
The public will also be able to meet and get an autograph from Olympic shot-put champion Valerie Adams. 
"I’m looking forward to meeting people on Sunday and watching them try their hand at all these different sports," says Valerie. "I want to encourage people to get active, get involved, and most importantly, have fun." 
Valerie Adams is an ambassador for New Zealand Post and its community sponsorship programmes. 
"We’re proud to support Valerie who is not just a top athlete, but a role model for children and families," says Jo Avenell. "She’s achieved success through hard work, dedication and fair play, and we can all learn something from her." 
Families making their plans for the day should note there is no parking on site, but there will be a free shuttle going to and from the Manukau Sports Bowl.
